definition: to eat humble pie/to accept humiliation/to turn the other cheek
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]
to keep/to contain/to suck (keep in your mouth without chewing)
dirt/disgrace
to bear shame and humiliation (idiom)
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
to bear humiliation to save one's skin (idiom)
to endure humiliation
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
castration (a form of punishment during the Han period)
to keep one's emotions inside oneself/to restrain one's emotions
seeking only ease and comfort (idiom); making no attempt to improve oneself/taking things easily without attending to responsibilities
servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. to lie on firewood and taste gall (idiom); fig. suffering patiently, but firmly resolved on revenge
to humiliate and torture/to suffer mutilation and humiliation
to keep going resolutely despite knowing the task is impossible (idiom)

definition: to be spat on in the face and let it dry by itself, not wiping it off (idiom); to turn the other cheek/to drain the cup of humiliation

base/low
